herbs.description: A tangy herbal drink made from dried hibiscus petals, known for its refreshing taste and potential health benefits including blood pressure regulation.
herbs.preparation: Boil dried petals in water for 10-15 minutes, strain and serve hot or cold
herbs.precautions: Avoid during pregnancy, may interact with blood pressure medications
herbs.honey_usage: Common sweetener to balance tartness

herbs.description: A warming herbal tea made from fresh or dried ginger root, known for its anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.
herbs.preparation: Slice fresh ginger and steep in hot water for 5-10 minutes
herbs.precautions: May cause heartburn in some people, avoid on empty stomach
herbs.honey_usage: Excellent with honey for soothing sore throat

herbs.description: A refreshing herbal tea made from fresh or dried mint leaves, known for its cooling properties and digestive benefits.
herbs.preparation: Steep fresh mint leaves in hot water for 3-5 minutes
herbs.precautions: Generally safe, may cause heartburn in some individuals
herbs.honey_usage: Light honey enhances the refreshing taste

herbs.description: A gentle herbal tea made from chamomile flowers, known for its calming and sleep-inducing properties.
herbs.preparation: Steep dried chamomile flowers in hot water for 5-7 minutes
herbs.precautions: May cause allergic reactions in people sensitive to ragweed
herbs.honey_usage: Honey enhances the calming effect

herbs.description: A citrusy herbal tea made from lemongrass stalks, known for its digestive and antimicrobial properties.
herbs.preparation: Boil fresh lemongrass stalks in water for 10-15 minutes
herbs.honey_usage: Honey balances the citrus notes beautifully

herbs.description: A golden herbal tea made from turmeric root, known for its powerful anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
herbs.preparation: Boil fresh turmeric root or powder with black pepper for 10 minutes
herbs.precautions: May interact with blood thinners, avoid on empty stomach
herbs.honey_usage: Honey and milk enhance absorption and taste

herbs.description: A warming herbal tea made from cinnamon bark, known for its blood sugar regulation and warming properties.
herbs.preparation: Steep cinnamon sticks in hot water for 5-10 minutes
herbs.precautions: May lower blood sugar, monitor if diabetic
herbs.honey_usage: Natural pairing that enhances sweetness

herbs.description: A fragrant herbal tea made from cardamom pods, known for its digestive and breath-freshening properties.
herbs.preparation: Crush cardamom pods and steep in hot water for 5-7 minutes
herbs.precautions: Generally safe, may cause heartburn in some people
herbs.honey_usage: Honey complements the aromatic flavor

herbs.description: A sweet herbal tea made from fennel seeds, known for its digestive and lactation-promoting properties.
herbs.preparation: Steep fennel seeds in hot water for 5-10 minutes
herbs.precautions: May affect hormone levels, avoid during pregnancy
herbs.honey_usage: Honey enhances the natural sweetness

herbs.description: A bitter herbal tea made from dandelion roots or leaves, known for its liver-supporting and diuretic properties.
herbs.preparation: Steep dried dandelion root or leaves in hot water for 10 minutes
herbs.precautions: May interact with diuretics, avoid if allergic to ragweed
herbs.honey_usage: Honey helps balance the bitter taste

herbs.description: Traditional herb valued for its respiratory effects and healing properties.
herbs.preparation: Extract burdock juice and dilute with water
herbs.honey_usage: Traditional combination with honey for soothing effects

herbs.description: Traditional herb valued for its first aid effects and healing properties.
herbs.preparation: Infuse celandine powder in warm water or milk
herbs.precautions: Use in moderation, avoid excessive consumption
herbs.honey_usage: Honey can be added for sweetness and antimicrobial properties
